title: Voter Apathy Rising But No One Cares

options.text: "No one cares about voting anymore," sighs @@RANDOM_NAME@@, chief of a watchdog organisation overseeing fair ballots. "Even I only got to my position because my mum's a member. This is supposed to be a democracy, yet less than a quarter of our population voted for your government! I believe that if we free up methods such as internet and phone voting then the people might actually feel inclined to give their opinions. It beats having to stand for hours in the rain to give a vote they privately feel will make no difference..." [[color=blue]Must have internet[/color]]
options.result: citizens may cast their vote over the internet or phone

policiesAndNotabilities.full: may add or remove notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "No one cares about voting anymore," sighs @@RANDOM_NAME@@, chief of a watchdog organisation overseeing fair ballots. "Even I only got to my position because my mum's a member. This is supposed to be a democracy, yet less than a quarter of our population voted for your government! I believe that if we free up methods such as postal and phone voting then the people might actually feel inclined to give their opinions. It beats having to stand for hours in the rain to give a vote they privately feel will make no difference..." [[color=red]Must not have internet[/color]]
options.result: citizens may cast their vote by mail or phone

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "The easier you make something the less anyone will care about it," says Catriona Wood, a political scientist with nothing to do. "The only real way to increase voter turnout is to force people to vote. Make it compulsory with executions for those who don't comply and then we'll have a true democracy! Sort of."
options.result: citizens who refuse to vote are guillotined

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: absence of drug laws
policiesAndNotabilities.name: absence of drug laws

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: restrictive gun laws
policiesAndNotabilities.name: restrictive gun laws

options.text: "The reason people aren't voting is because they're quite happy with how things are," says @@RANDOM_NAME@@, lounging in a deck chair. "If people can't be bothered to vote then why not just do away with the whole thing altogether? Come the next election, just set yourself up as dictator for life and everyone can get back to whatever they'd rather be doing. Now please go away, you're standing in my rays."
options.result: citizens are more concerned about voting for Big Brother contestants than politicians

options.text: "I think you're approaching this the wrong way," says Andrew Lavelle, the proprietor of UltraCorp-SmithMax Chemicals Inc. "If people can't get out and about, it's clearly due to a lack of energy. Our product range includes an ideal solution; we could add POWERTHIRST [TM] to the national water supply! And better yet, it only has a very slight risk of causing zombification or exploding cattle!"
options.result: insomnia is slowly turning everyone insane

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: deadly medical pandemics
policiesAndNotabilities.name: deadly medical pandemics

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "I, ah..., I think... ah, just do whatever," says @@RANDOM_NAME@@, checking the time again. "I don't have time for this. Bye!"
